title: 1D motion - compare directions of v and a

content.description: The graph represents the position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> of an object as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>. Compare the directions of the velocities <math alttext="v sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and the directions of the accelerations <math alttext="lowercase a, sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="lowercase a, sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, of the object at times <math alttext="t sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>.
content.question: VelocitiesAccelerationsASame directionSame directionBSame directionOpposite directionsCOpposite directionsSame directionDOpposite directionsOpposite directions

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
